dublin_core.dcvalue: The Open Smart Register Platform (OpenSRP) can run on any Android device and integrates previously dicrete proven innovations in mHealth. OpenSRP complements other widely-deployed information technology solutions, including DHIS2 and OpenMRS.
CHW, Community member, CHW, Facility-based provider, Facility-based patient, Facility, Public sector health system (national, regional, district), Government agency
Garrett Mehl, Scientist, World Health Organization-RHR/HRP, Email: mehlg@who.int

Gaibanda District (Rangpur Division), Bangladesh; Lombok District (West Nusa Tenggara Province), Indonesia; Sindh Province, Pakistan; Koppal district (Karnatka State), India; Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal districts (Maharashtra State), India
WHO Department of Reproductive Health and Research (RHR-HRP)

Client education and behavior change communication, Data collection and reporting, Electronic decision support, Electronic health records, Human resource management, Provider-to-provider communication, Provider work planning and scheduling, Provider training and education, Registries and vital events tracking, Child health, Family planning, Maternal health, Newborn health, Nutrition/food security, Sexual and reproductive health, Tuberculosis
